string-array.name: topics_array
string-array.item: Science
Technology
History
Music
Movies
Sports
Politics

string-array.name: factArray1
string-array.item: The largest beetle is the goliath beetle
The first plastic was called bakelite
Palaentologists study fossils
An Ohm is the SI unit for resistance
The Aorta is the largest Artery in the human body
The chemical compound for Sulfuric Acid is H2 SO4
A baby Whale is called a calf
Adrenaline is a hormone that stimulates the nervous system
In Fahrenheit the boiling point of water is 212 degress
The common name for sodium chloride is salt

string-array.name: factArray2
string-array.item: Solar power is generated from the sun
The first Apple iPhone became available in 2007
CPU stands for Central Processing Unit
The Hubble Space Telescope was named after Edwin Hubble
The first Harley Davidson motorcycle was built in 1903
Firefox, Opera, Chrome, Safari and Explorer are web browsers
On a standard 747 jumbo jet there are 420 seats
It takes about 1,100 watts to run an electric toaster
About 1.8 billion light bulbs are produced in the United States each year

string-array.name: factArray3
string-array.item: In 1000 B.C. Israelites payed their taxes with Raisins
Until 1796 Tennessee was known as Franklin
Abraham Lincoln was assassinated in a theatre
Pablo Picasso had his first painting exhibition at the age of 16
New Zealand was the first country to allow women to vote in 1903
The Titanic was the first ocean liner to have a swimming pool
The Hundred Years War lasted 116 years
Napolean died in exile on the island of St. Helen
There are 6000 men in a Roman legion
John adams was the second president of the united states

string-array.name: factArray4
string-array.item: Rage Against the Machines first single debut was Bombtrack
From The Cradle was an album written by Eric Clapton
Bono is a member of the band U2
George Harrison wrote My Sweet Love
Brass in the pocket was a hit song by The Pretenders
David Bowie Teamed with Queen to write Under Pressure
Blue Oyster Cult wrote the song Dont Fear
Motown originated in Detroit
Supertramp released the song Breakfast in America
Rick Rolled

string-array.name: factArray5
string-array.item: Ill be back was a signature line in the film The Terminator
Al Pacino won an oscar for the line "hoo-ah"
In the movie Philadelphia Tom Hanks and Antonio Banderas are paired as lovers
Tom Hanks voiced the character Woody from Toy Story
the line "You cant handle the truth" comes from the film A Few Good Men
In the move The Mask Jim Carrey plays a bank clerk
Patrick Swayze played Johnny Castle in Footloose
Harrison Ford is the famous character Indiana Jones
The song The Bear Necessities is from the movie Jungle Book
The Lady and the Tramp is about dogs

string-array.name: factArray6
string-array.item: The term home run originated from Cricket
The Dodgers were the only team to win two world series championships in the 1980s
The Dallas Cowboys were the first professional football team to hire a cheerleading squad
The Americas cup is a best of nine racing series
32 teams are allowed at the world cup
Jockey Wilson can be associated with darts
A game of field hockey lasts 70 minutes
In the 1970s numbers made their appearence on football jerseys
Nikes logo is called the swoosh
The Detroit Red Wings are a hockey team

string-array.name: factArray7
string-array.item: The First President was George Washington
The Second President was John Adams
The third president was Thomas Jefferson
The fourth president was James Madison
The fifth president was James Monroe
The sixth president was Andrew Jackson
The seventh president was John Quincy Adams
The eighth president was Martin Van Buren
The ninth president was William Harrison
The tenth president was John Tyler
